critique: This document primarily concerns the preservation and exhibition of government materials with historical significance. It directs executive departments and agencies to coordinate with the Administrator of General Services to ensure that exhibits and displays are created in a manner suitable for preservation and potential future exhibition. The order also directs the transfer of such exhibits to the Administrator after their primary purpose has been served. There is no direct impact on immigration, civil liberties, or economic regulation. The order could be seen as slightly expanding federal control over historical materials, but it is primarily an administrative matter. There is no clear ideological tilt.
